page.title: 17MOTSPUR PARK BRANCH LINE
page.content: This 4.5_mile branch is less than half of the planned Leatherhead Loop, & has the sad double distinction of being the last stretch of surface railway to be built in Britain, & of being aban_ doned because of{World War II.} {Constructed by}Southern Railways{ {before the days of nationalisation, {the line was meant to 'cash in' on the {suburban expansion envisaged after the {opening of the}Kingston By_Pass.{ { }The line opened on May 28, 1939, & its 'modern' feel was encapsulated by the avant_garde design of the station shelters. {Beyond Chessington South station, {the line runs as far as the coaling {yard. After that, another 33 chains {distance is all that exists of the {track, though the embankment extends } {past the 14_mile sign (from}WATERLOO).
